resource.chars:
M. Gratiolet in a late communication to the Academie 
des Sciences takes the same view -
situated on the ventral surface of the 
animal in the middle line just behind 
the insertion of the great adductor muscles -
To get rid of the obvious difficulty - that 
this spot is covered by the shell and therefore 
that [text?] if the anus existed 
here, then would be no road of escape 
for the faeces, Mr. Hancock and Mr Woodward 
appear to be inclined to suppose that 
some cloacal aperture must exist 
beside the pedicle.
The existence of any such aperture, however 
has recently been denied with great justice 
by Prof. Owen -
The result of my own repeated examination 
of Rhynchonella psittacea and of Waldheimia 
flavescens - is to that the intestine does not 
terminate on the right side of the mantle 
as Prof. Owen describes it, but in Waldheimia 
in the middle line as Mr Hancock describes it.
